title: 820-0016 MISSING PM_BATLOW_L
message:
Good day guys

am currently busy on a board, and I am struggling to get the PM_BATLOW_L signal, I have replaced the known good SMC but no changes, the same SMC works okay on a different board and I get PM_BATLOW_L, but on this board, I don't have it, other SMC output signals are present and my ppbus voltage is properly regulated by the SMC too. I checked for a short to ground and there's non, is there somewhere I need to check for this signal? without the signal being created, am unable to move forward, please help.

title: 820-0016 MISSING PM_BATLOW_L
message: What wattage charger are you using ?

title: 820-0016 MISSING PM_BATLOW_L
message:
Be sure to use original Magsafe 2 charger; no matters 45-85W.

Do you get amber light and battery is charging?
Steady 3V3_S5/SUS?
Check R1410...

title: 820-0016 MISSING PM_BATLOW_L
message: [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER], 3V3_S5/SUS is steady, R1410 has 3.3V on pin 1 but less than 1V on pin 2, when I disconnect the resistor from the PM_BATLOW_L line , i got 3.3V and there's no short to ground

title: 820-0016 MISSING PM_BATLOW_L
message: Did you check if R1410 has correct ohm value???

title: 820-0016 MISSING PM_BATLOW_L
message: [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER] yes R1410 has the correct value, compared to a known working board

title: 820-0016 MISSING PM_BATLOW_L
message:
"Do you get amber light and battery is charging?"

Try to start with charger and battery, both connected.

title: 820-0016 MISSING PM_BATLOW_L
message: I get the amber light, I tried to start the machine with charger and battery but no changes.

title: 820-0016 MISSING PM_BATLOW_L
message:
Thank you guys, I apologize, for my mistakes, when [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER] asked this  (3V3_S5/SUS is steady)  I did check but did not hold the probe point longer to see that after sometimes the voltage drops and then go back up, so I resolved that, and the board is now resolved.
Thank you so much [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER] and [USER=461]@Gurmon[/USER].
